channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How Visa wove AI into every facet of the company by approaching it as both a science and an art
item.description: Visa, which is one of the top-ranked companies on the Fortune AIQ 50 list, made its first big AI investment a decade ago.

item.title: Supreme Court Hears Free Speech Challenge to Ban on Conversion Therapy
item.description: The court’s ruling in the Colorado case will have implications for more than 20 other states with similar laws.

item.title: ‘Our chapters will work for any enterprise’: Honeywell’s AI chiefs share the strategies that helped the firm mature its AI efforts
item.description: The company’s “six-chapter framework” includes sections for sales effectiveness and for everyday workflows, keeping the focus on use cases that will t...

item.title: How to Protect Your Pets From Pollution
item.description: Wildfire smoke, lead paint and other environmental toxins are health hazards for animals, too.

item.title: Ex-PayPal chief Dan Schulman appointed CEO of Verizon
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Israel Marks Two-Year Anniversary of Oct. 7 in Subdued Fashion
item.description: The second anniversary of the Oct. 7 attacks comes with peace talks underway, but with hostages still in Gaza, more than 67,000 Palestinians dead and ...

item.title: One common thread at some of the companies seeing the most success with AI: Woman CEOs
item.description: While women make up only 11% of the chief executives at Fortune 500 companies, they represent 18% of the AIQ 50—an encouraging sign as AI becomes incr...

item.title: Winning a Nobel Prize Interrupted His Off-the-Grid Vacation
item.description: Fred Ramsdell found out about his Nobel Prize nearly 12 hours after it was announced because he was on vacation in the Rockies.

item.title: Entrepreneur says Goldman Sachs once gave him 39 separate interviews to land the job—and the decisive conversation was less than a minute
item.description: Goldman Sachs' acceptance rate for internships is less than 1%.

item.title: Nobel Prize in Physics Is Awarded for Work in Quantum Mechanics
item.description: The prize was awarded to John Clarke, Michel H. Devoret and John M. Martinis.

item.title: One Hostage’s Path to Healing and Advocacy
item.description: Emily Damari spent 471 days in captivity in Gaza. Since being released, Ms. Damari, a British Israeli, has become a symbol of resilience and a voice f...

item.title: What to Know About Carney and Trump’s White House Meeting

item.title: We Tried to Reach Gazans We Interviewed Over Two Years of War. Here’s What Happened to Them.
item.description: We kept wondering: Did they find their missing relatives? Were they even still alive?
